intro: Kotschya princeana, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange inflorescences that resemble misty clouds. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Kotschya princeana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
